alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued October 07 at 5:02PM MST until October 07 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 600 PM MST. * At 501 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 12 miles west of Kearny to Coolidge to 9 miles west of Casa Grande to 7 miles south of Freeman, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 161 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 130 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 202 and 227. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Casa Grande, Apache Junction, Florence, Coolidge, Superior, Gold Canyon, Sun Lakes, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Estrella, Arizona City and San Tan Valley. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
